alert.note: Alert for East Washington Central Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 15 at 6:17AM PDT until July 17 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Hot temperatures, gusty winds and low humidities Sunday and Monday... .The breakdown of a hot ridge of high pressure and the arrival of a dry cold front will bring critical fire conditions to much of central and eastern Washington this weekend. Ahead of the front Sunday afternoon, hot south or southwest winds are expected to develop across central and north central Washington. Then on Monday, strong west winds will blow across central and eastern Washington behind the cold front. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR EAST WASHINGTON CENTRAL CASCADES... The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Monday morning through Monday evening. * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 696 East Washington Central Cascades (Zone 696). * Winds: West 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidities: 15 to 30 percent in the valleys and 25 to 35 percent over the higher terrain. Locally around 50 percent closer to the immediate Cascade Crest. * Impacts: New and existing fires have the potential to spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
